ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Seneca Power Partners, L.P., Volume No. 1 (Market-Based)

record_data.record_narrative_name: Seneca Power Partners, L.P., Ninth Revised Volume No. 1 (Market-Based) (Form of Service Agreement)
record_data.record_plain_text: FORM OF SERVICE AGREEMENT BETWEEN SENECA POWER PARTNERS, L.P. AND [PURCHASER) FOR ELECTRIC POWER SALES AND THE RESALE OF TRANSMISSION RIGHTS THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into this day of 20_ by and between Seneca Power Partners, L.P. and (hereinafter referred to as Purchaser), a customer under Seneca Power Partners, L.P.s FERC Electric Tariff Volume No.1, who shall be collectively referred to as the Parties and may be individually referred to as the Party. In consideration of mutual benefits from the covenants herein set forth, Seneca Power Partners, L.P. and the Purchaser do hereby agree as follows: Section 1. SERVICE TO BE PROVIDED 1.1 Service to Be Provided: Seneca Power Partners, L.P. will provide service under its FERC Electric Tariff Volume No. 1 in accordance with its terms, this Service Agreement and any other terms and conditions that the Parties may agree to, based on the specifics of a particular transaction. 1.2 Terms and Conditions for Transactions: The terms and conditions for each transaction entered into under this Service Agreement shall be as negotiated by the Parties. Those terms and conditions shall include, at a minimum, specific terms as to quantity, price, delivery point(s), time period and firmness of the wholesale power services, including capacity and energy services. Seneca Power Partners, L.P. will separately state the prices for wholesale power services, including capacity and energy services. Section 2. BILLING AND PAYMENTS 2.1 Submission of Payment: Bills for amounts due to Seneca Power Partners, L.P. hereunder rendered shall be submitted, and payments shall be due, under terms to be specified by the Parties. (a) All bills rendered by Seneca Power Partners, L.P. shall be sent to: __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ (b) All payments by Purchaser shall be wire transferred to: __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ Section 3. GENERAL PROVISIONS 3.1 Regulatory Approval: This Service Agreement will be filed with the FERC. 3.2 Changes in Rates, Terms and Conditions of Service: Changes in rates, charges, terms or conditions of any transaction under this Service Agreement shall only be upon mutual consent of the Parties. No modifications of this Service Agreement shall become effective except by written amendment executed by the Parties. Neither Party shall unilaterally file for modification of this Service Agreement pursuant to Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act. Any modification of this Service Agreement shall be filed with FERC. 3.3 Termination: This Service Agreement shall not be terminated, prior to the expiration of the term of the Service Agreement, without written amendment executed by the Parties. 3.4 Representations and Warranties: Each Party warrants that it has the corporate power and/or legal authority to execute, deliver and perform all the terms and provisions of this Service Agreement. Each Party further represents that the individuals executing this Service Agreement on its respective behalf have been duly authorized to do so and that such execution creates a valid, binding and legally enforceable obligation of each Party. 3.5 Assignments: Except as provided herein, neither Party may assign this Service Agreement or its rights hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party to the Service Agreement, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Seneca Power Partners, L.P. may, without consent of the other Party, collaterally assign its rights to this Service Agreement to its lenders. Either Party may, without consent of the other Party, assign this Service Agreement to any person succeeding to all or substantially all of the assigning partys assets, provided that such person assumes all obligations of the assignor under this Service Agreement. No assignment under this Section shall relieve the assigning Party from liability under this Service Agreement. 3.6 Binding Effect: The terms and provisions of this Service Agreement and the respective rights and obligations hereunder of each Party shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of its successors and assigns. In the event the Purchaser assigns or resells to another customer any portion of the capacity and/or energy purchased hereunder, the Purchaser remains liable to Seneca Power Partners, L.P. for payment of the full amount of such assigned or resold capacity and/or energy. 3.7 Notices: Written notices required by this Service Agreement shall be deemed properly sent if delivered in person or sent by facsimile, registered or certified mail, or by overnight courier service, postage prepaid, to the persons specified below: (a) If to Seneca Power Partners, L.P.: __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ (b) If to Purchaser: __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ __________________________________________ Any name and/or address hereunder may be changed by written notice by one Party to the other without making a filing at FERC. 3.8 Choice of Law: This Service Agreement and all transactions hereunder shall be governed by, interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of New York. 3.9 Non-waiver of Defaults: The failure of either Party to enforce at any time any of the provisions of this Service Agreement, or to require performance of any of the provisions hereof, shall not be construed as a waiver of such provisions nor affect the validity of this Service Agreement or any part hereof or affect the right of such Party thereafter to enforce each and every such provision. 3.10 Severability: If any portion of this Service Agreement is declared invalid or unenforceable by any regulatory body or court of competent jurisdiction by final and nonappealable order, the remaining provisions of this Service Agreement shall not be affected and shall remain in full force and effect. In such event, the Parties shall promptly renegotiate to restore this Service Agreement as nearly as possible to its original intent and effect. 3.11 Headings Not to Affect Meaning: The descriptive headings of the various Sections of this Service Agreement are inserted for convenience only and shall not restrict or modify the terms and provisions hereof. 3.12 Survival: Any provision of this Service Agreement that expressly or by implication comes into or remains in force following the termination of this Service Agreement shall survive such termination including, but not limited to, fulfillment of payment obligations for services rendered pursuant to this Service Agreement. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have caused this Service Agreement to be signed and scaled as of the day and year first above written by their duly authorized representatives. SENECA POWER PARTNERS, L.P. ________________________ Name Title [PURCHASER] ________________________ Name Title

record_data.record_narrative_name: Seneca Power Partners, L.P., Ninth Revised Volume No. 1 (Market-Based)(Ancillary Services)
record_data.record_plain_text: Ancillary Services 1. Availability: Seneca Power Partners, L.P. (Seneca Power Partners or seller) makes the following ancillary services available: A. New York: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. 2. Applicability: This Tariff is applicable to all sales of the above ancillary services, by Seneca Power Partners not otherwise subject to a particular tariff of Seneca Power Partners. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seneca Power Partners. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Seneca Power Partners.

record_data.record_narrative_name: Seneca Power Partners, L.P., Ninth Revised Volume No. 1 (Market-Based)(Tariff)
record_data.record_plain_text: 1. Availability: Seneca Power Partners, L.P. (Seneca Power Partners or seller) makes wholesale power, including energy and capacity, available under this Tariff to any purchaser for resale. 2. Applicability: This Tariff is applicable to all wholesale power sales, including energy and capacity sales, by Seneca Power Partners not otherwise subject to a particular tariff of Seneca Power Partners. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seneca Power Partners. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Seneca Power Partners. 5. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning sellers market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the sellers market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning sellers market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Seneca Power Partners market-based rate authority is not subject to any limitations. Seneca Power Partners has been granted the following waivers and blanket authorization: (a) waiver of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information, except for sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; (b) waiver of the accounting and other requirements of Parts 41, 101 and 141; and (c) blanket approval as to section 204 of the Federal Power Act and Part 34 of the Commissions regulations for all future issuances of securities and assumption of liabilities. See AG-Energy, L.P., Docket No. ER98-2782-000 (letter order issued June 17, 1998). 7. Effective Date: This Tariff is effective as of the date specified by the Commission. 8. Seller Category: Seller is a Category 1 seller in all regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a).
